intro: Ardisia caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean evergreen or sweetshrub, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are attractive to birds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in tropical and subtropical regions. Ardisia caribaea is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
